DOCNAME: CASE OF DOST AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6-1 (length of proceedings);Partly inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the FAC Governor ’s office expropriated a plot of land belonging to the applicants . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plot of land and the relevant amount was paid to them when the expropriation took place .

CARDINAL . Following the ORG request for increased compensation , on DATE ORG of First - instance awarded them an additional compensation of MONEY ( TRL ) plus interest at the statutory rate running from DATE , the date on which the title - deed to the land had been transferred to the ORG . In the course of the proceedings , the court conducted on - site visits and requested CARDINAL expert reports which concluded that the land in question was development land ( arsa ) . In view of a judgment rendered by ORG of ORG which ruled that the lands within the vicinity of the FAC organised industrial zone should be considered as agricultural lands , the court decided that it would not take the CARDINAL expert reports into account . It therefore relied on a fourth expert report which served as a conciliation report for a calculation of the amount due to the applicants .

CARDINAL . The applicants appealed against the judgment of ORG of First - instance . In their submissions , the applicants contested the court ’s decision to take solely the last expert report into consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG of First - instance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG paid the amount of GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicants’ request for rectification .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) .
